remixlab.bias.ext

Class Profile

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.ext.Profile

  • public class Profile
extends Object
    A Grabber extension which allows to define Shortcut to Method bindings. See setBinding(Shortcut, String) and setBinding(Object, Shortcut, String) .

    To attach a profile to a grabber first override your Grabber.performInteraction(BogusEvent) method like this: 

     
   public void performInteraction(BogusEvent event) {
     profile.handle(event);
   }
    (see handle(BogusEvent)) and then simply pass the grabber instance to the Profile(Grabber) constructor.

      • registerMotionID

        public static int registerMotionID(int id,
                                   int dof)
        Registers a BogusEvent.id() to the Profile.
        Parameters:
        id - the intended BogusEvent.id() to be registered
        dof - Motion id degrees-of-freedom.. Either 1,2,3, or 6.
        Returns:
        the id or an exception if the id exists.
        See Also:
        registerMotionID(int)

      • handle

        public boolean handle(BogusEvent event)
        Main class method to be called from Grabber.performInteraction(BogusEvent). Calls an action handler if the BogusEvent.shortcut() is bound.
        See Also:
        setBinding(Shortcut, String), setBinding(Object, Shortcut, String)

      • setBinding

        public void setBinding(Shortcut key,
                       String action)
        Defines the shortcut that triggers the given action.

        The action is a method implemented by the grabber() that returns void and may have a BogusEvent parameter, or no parameters at all. A MotionEvent or a DOFnEvent() that matches the Shortcut.id() dofs may be passed to the action when binding a MotionShortcut. A KeyboardEvent and a ClickEvent should always be passed to the action when binding a KeyboardShortcut and a ClickShortcut, respectively.

        Parameters:
        key - Shortcut
        action - String
        See Also:
        setBinding(Object, Shortcut, String)

      • setBinding

        public void setBinding(Object object,
                       Shortcut key,
                       String action)
        Defines the shortcut that triggers the given action.

        The action is a method implemented by the object that returns void and may have a BogusEvent parameter, or no parameters at all. A MotionEvent or a DOFnEvent() that matches the Shortcut.id() dofs may be passed to the action when binding a MotionShortcut. A KeyboardEvent and a ClickEvent should always be passed to the action when binding a KeyboardShortcut and a ClickShortcut, respectively.

        Parameters:
        object - Object
        key - Shortcut
        action - String
        See Also:
        setBinding(Object, Shortcut, String)
